intro: Crucihimalaya tenuisiliqua, commonly known as the slender Himalayan crucifix, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. It is often found growing in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters.
